text: Carmarthenshire (;"Carmarthenshire" , British & World English Dictionary, Oxford Dictionaries Online ; or informally ) is a unitary authority in southwest Wales, and one of the historic counties of Wales. The largest town in Carmarthenshire is Llanelli, a market town with a population of 25,000. The area has many farms, and the land is very rural and has many hills. ==Towns== Carmarthenshire has twelve towns, which are listed below. Carmarthenshire also has many villages. *Ammanford *Burry Port *Carmarthen *Kidwelly *Laugharne *Llandeilo *Llandovery *Llanelli *Llanybydder *Newcastle Emlyn *St Clears *Whitland ==References==
title: Carmarthenshire
